DataElement.preferredName: Participant Eligibility Determination Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to a question that asks is the participant is eligiblebased on the technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue and the method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis (CT).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Eligibility Determination Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertining to someone who takes part in an activity and the criteria used to determine eligibility of participants for medical care programs and services based on the technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET) and a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis (CT).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Eligibility Determination Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.:A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A choice of Yes and No answer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A Conceptual Domain to capture value meanings specfic to SPOREs not suitable for placement elsewhere.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Changed name to match Context per Hvroje Med.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
